data.meta_description: L'Information Psychiatrique - Revue mensuelle des Psychiatres des Hôpitaux - Volume 88, N°4, Avril 2012 by J.-C. Pascal, P. Le Malefan, T. Danel, F. Mignaval, P. Bret, M.-C. Bret, E. Queille, A. Van Effenterre, M. Azoulay, X. Briffault, F. Champion, B. Pachoud, P.H. Lysaker, M.Erickson, K.D. Buck, G. Dimaggio, M. Koenig-Flahaut, M.-C. Castillo, V. Schaer, P. Le Borgne, J.-H. Bouleau, A. Blanchet, M. Montreuil, C. Coupé, J.-L. Truelle. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
1st Edition, 1965 Book condition, Etat : Bon hardcover, editor's full green printed clothes binding, no dust-jacket grand In-8 1 vol. - 229 pages Contents, Chapitres : List of Contributors, Preface, Contents, ix, Text, 220 pages - J.L. Walsh : The convergence of sequences of rational functions of best approximation with some free poles - Arthur Sard : Uses of Hilbert spaces in approximation - R.C. Buck : Applications of duality in approximation theory - Lothar Collatz : Inclusion theorems for the minimal distance in rational Tchebyscheff approximation with several variables - P. Fox, A.A. Goldstein and G. Lastman : Rational approximation on finite point sets - E.L. Stiefel : Phase methods for polynomial approximation - Michael Golomb : Optimal and nearly-optimal linear approximation - E.W. Cheney : Approximation by generalized rational functions - J.R. Rice : Nonlinear approximation - F.L. Bauer : Nonlinear sequence transformations - P.J. Davis : Approximation theory in the first two decades of electronic computers - Garrett Birkhoff and C.R. De Boor : Piecewise polynomial interpolation and approximation - G.G. Lorentz : Russian literature on approximation in 1958-1964 - Index editor's binding is clean with adhesive tracks on the bottom of the spine and the bottom of the boards, inside is clean, few ex-library stamps and markings on the title-page, the main text remains clean and unmarked, a good reading copy 600.

LeatherBound. Condition: New. LeatherBound edition. Condition: New. Reprinted from 1876 edition. Leather Binding on Spine and Corners with Golden leaf printing on spine. Bound in genuine leather with Satin ribbon page markers and Spine with raised gilt bands. A perfect gift for your loved ones. NO changes have been made to the original text. This is NOT a retyped or an ocr'd reprint. Illustrations, Index, if any, are included in black and white. Each page is checked manually before printing. As this print on demand book is reprinted from a very old book, there could be some missing or flawed pages, but we always try to make the book as complete as possible. Fold-outs, if any, are not part of the book. If the original book was published in multiple volumes then this reprint is of only one volume, not the whole set. Sewing binding for longer life, where the book block is actually sewn (smythe sewn/section sewn) with thread before binding which results in a more durable type of binding. Pages: 172 Language: English.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good-. Vol. 21, No. 5. Edited by Robert P. Mills. Cover by Emsh for "Naked to the Stars" (pt. 2) by Gordon R. Dickson. Includes "Hybrid" by Keith Laumer; "The Other End of the Line" by Walter Tevis; "The Interplanetary Cat" by Rick Rubin; "Faq'" by George P. Elliott; "Ferdinand Feghoot: XLV" by Grendel Briarton [Reginald Bretnor]; "Green Sunrise" by Doris Pitkin Buck; "The Tunnel Ahead" by Alice Glaser; "Mustang" by Randall Garrett; "Science: Sethronement" by Isaac Asimov; "Books" (reviews) by Alfred Bester; "Cosmic Gall" (verse) by John Updike; "About Something Truly Wonderful" by Algis Budrys. 1" tear with loss at heel; glued at inside lower front hinge; front cover edge falls short of text block; minor tears and extra bit to upper edge, last two pages.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good. Vol. 14, No. 2. Edited by Anthony Boucher. Cover art by Emsh for "Baby" by Carol Emshwiller. Includes "Pilgrimage" by Chad Oliver; "The Better Bet" (verse) by Anthony Brode; "Love Me, Love My -" by Rog Phillips; "The Man Who Never Forgot" by Robert Silverberg; "The Last Step" by Zenna Henderson; "The Exchange Student" by Allen Kim Lang; "I Do Not Hear You, Sir" by Avram Davidson; "The Last of the Deliverers" by Poul Anderson; "One Sent" by Mary-Carter Roberts; "Curved Universe" (verse) by Doris P. Buck; "Recommended Reading" (department) by anthony Boucher; "A Summer Afternoon" by Charles L. Fontenay; "I Just Make Them Up, See!" (verse) by Isaac Asimov. Tanning; small tears; minor lean.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good+. Vol. 26, No. 2. Edited by Avram Davidson, Edward L. Ferman, & Ted White. Cover art by Jack Gaughan for "The House by the Crab Tree" (novelet) by S. S. Johnson. Includes"The Shepherd of Esdon pen" by P. M. Hubbard; "Our Fuzzy Moon" by Theodore L. Thomas; "Ms Found in a Bottle" (verse) by Harry Harrison; "Nobody Starves" by Ron Goulart; "One Hundred Days From Home" by Dean McLaughlin; "Science: The Slowly Moving Finger" by Isaac Asimov; "Little Gregory" (novelet) by Evelyn E. Smith; "Books" by Avram Davidson; "Burning Spear" by Kit Denton; "In the Bag" by Laurence M. Janifer; "The Fan: Myth and Reality" by Wilson Tucker; "Come Where My Love Lies Dreaming" by Doris Pitkin Buck; "Editorial"; "Letters"; "F&SF Marketplace". Tanning; stray mark inside cover; edge and corner nicks and wear, particularly at spine ends; minor soiling.

SingleIssueMagazine. Condition: Very Good+ to Near Fine. Vol. 3, No. 6. Edited by Anthony Boucher & Francis J. McComas. Cover art by Chesley Bonestell ("Saturn, as seen from Dione). Includes "Grenville's Planet" by Michael Shaara; "The Black Ball" (Gavagan's Bar series) by L. Sprague de Camp & Fletcher Pratt; "Talents" (novelette) by J. T. M'Intosh; "Unpleasantness at Budleigh Court" by P. G. Wodehouse; "The First" by Anthony Boucher; "Old Man Morgan's Grave" by Miriam Allen Deford; "The Darker Drink" (novelette; Simon Templar series) by Leslie Charteris; "An Egg a Month From All Over" by Idris Seabright [Margaret St. Clair]; "Aunt Agatha" by Doris P. Buck; "Ararat" (novelette; first in The People series) by Zenna Henderson; "The Third Level" by Jack Finney; "Recommended Reading". Minor edge, corner and spine nicks; tanning; slight rear cover crease.

Stapled. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Harrison Fisher (cover), Harold von Schmidt, Dan Content, R F Schabelitz, Paul Brown, Marshall Frantz, James Montgomery Flagg (Easter Parade & Thank You, Jeeves!) (illustrator). First Edition. The April 1934 issue of Hearst's International combined with Cosmopolitan magazine. Fiction includes most notably One Trip Across, a short story by Ernest Hemingway (Harold von Schmidt, father of folksinger Eric von Schmidt, illustrations); and part 4 of 6 of Thank You, Jeeves!, a novel by P G Wodehouse (James Montgomery Flagg illustrations). Other literature & articles include Does the World Stand on the Verge of a Spiritual Rebirth?, an article by noted psychiatrist C G Jung (Harold von Schmidt illustrations); Fool's Sacrifice, a short story by Pearl S Buck (Dan Content illustrations); Sweepstake, a short novel by Faith Baldwin (R F Schabelitz illustrations); The Grand National, a "Cosmopolitan Sketchbook" by Damon Runyan (Paul Brown illustrations); Easter Parade, a poem by, Ogden Nash (James Montgomery Flagg sketches); Gram, a short story by Kathleen Norris (Marshall Frantz, illustrations); and others. Front cover illustration by Harrison Fisher. Condition issues include: the front cover is loose and has light edge wear & creases; light soiling to the spine & back cover. A good copy, that would grade very good except for the loose cover, with fiction by prominent and collectible authors.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. viii, 280 pp. ; green cloth with gold lettering ; Contents:Crusaders All / Dr. William L. Ayres -- Roses In My Life / Penelope D. Salveson -- Preciousness Versus Appreciation / Grace Kemmerling Wellington-- The Rose: Twelve Varieties Of It (From Pliny's Natural History) / John Bostock And H. T. Riley-- Roses And The Art Of Healing / Dr. E. C. Hamblen-- Roses For The Television Age / E. A. Piester-- A Rose / The Rev. Paul H. Kratzig -- Dr. Spencer S. Sulliger / Quimby L. Matthews-- Roses In The Grass / Mrs. R. C. Arellano-- How To Grow Roses, In 7000 Easy Lessons / Mrs. Lois Spencer-- Differences Of Opinion / G. H. Drinkwater-- Notes Of A Neophyte / Phil H. Lewis-- Pacific Northwest Roses / Fred Edmunds-- Roses In The Mile High / Everett 0. Nord-- Soil Considerations / Dr. Charles B. Kellogg-- New Concepts Of Soil Improvement / Harry L. Daunoy -- The Key To Soil Fertility / Donald H. Williams-- Foliage Fertilization / Dr. G. Ellington Jorgenson-- Trace Elements In Plant Nutrition / Col. B. H. Jenkins -- Climbing Roses For Landscape Pictures / Emilia Burke-- Lawns, Nothing But The Best / Fred V. Grau-- Varieties Of Rose Understocks / Griffith J. Buck -- Standards For Judging Roses : Classification / Dr. R. C. Allen -- Know Varieties / Clarence Davis-- Form / C. H. Lewis -- Substance And Color / Dr. James B. Shanks-- Stem And Foliage / C. Eugene Pfister-- Summary / Dr. Conrad B. Link -- Problems Of The Rose Breeder / Dr. S. L. Rmsweller -- Just How Fragrant Are The Old Roses / Dr. Walter E. Lammerts -- Spider Mites And Their Control / Prof. W. E. Blauvelt -- Winter Protection Of Roses In Cold Climates / Dr. Peter P. Lawlor -- Hybrid Musks / Roy E. Shepherd -- Nicholson Bowl Award -- Showing Roses In Australia / R. T. Hamilton-- Hardier Hybrid Teas / Prof. Stephen F. Hamblin-- Single Roses I Grow And Love / Mrs. R. D. Dorsett-- Roses Of The Old South / Julia Lester Dillon-- Does Waxing Affect Growth? / J. A. Foret-- The Influence Of Torage Temperatures And Pruning Practices On Some Outdoor Roses / B. B. Janne And Dr. L. C. Chadwick -- Freezing Studies Of Outdoor Roses / Leonard E. Carrier -- The Admirable Old Roses / J. R. Carabin -- How Ro Tell Hybrid Perpetuals / George B. Lippincott -- A Survey Of Hybrid Perpetuals / Howard J. Tenner -- Proof Of The Pudding -- Contributors To Proof Of The Pudding -- New Roses Of The World -- Roses Patented -- Index -- Illustrations -- Lambertus C. Bobbink -- Golden Scepter (In Color) -- First Love (In Color) -- Hedda Hopper And Connie Mack (In Color) -- Imp And Irene Of Denmark (In Color) -- Symphonie (In Color) -- White Pinocchio (In Color) -- Valentine (In Color) -- Volcano (In Color) -- Bravo (In Color) -- Opera (In Color) -- Happiness (In Color) -- Spider Mites -- Suzon Lotthe (In Color) -- Dr. O. M. Harper -- Rose Of Freedom (In Color) -- Mission Bells (In Color) -- Hill Top (In Color) -- Capistrano (In Color) ; spine sunned ; a few faint spots on front cover ; no dustjacket ; G. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Coasts and Seas of the United Kingdom: The Coastal Directories Project: Region 11: the Western Approaches: Falmouth Bay to Kenfig This book is in very good condition and will be shipped within 24 hours of ordering. The cover may have some limited signs of wear but the pages are clean, intact and the spine remains undamaged. This book has clearly been well maintained and looked after thus far.
